intro: Agrostis magellanica var. antarctica, commonly known as Antarctic hairgrass, is a low-growing grass species native to the cold regions of the Southern Hemisphere. It thrives in high-altitude and polar environments, often found in Antarctica, South America, and southern Australia. This plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and fine, silver-green blades that are adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. It plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for microorganisms in extreme environments. Its resilience and unique morphology make it an important subject in studies of plant adaptation to cold climates.
